intro: Barrosoa organensis, commonly known as the organensis barrosoa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth, glossy surface. Barrosoa organensis is often found in moist, well-drained soils in tropical and subtropical environments.
